title: Aubergine and tofu stir-fry
time: Takes 15 minutes to make, 10 minutes to cook
description: A quick vegan stir-fry recipe recipe made with aubergine, tofu and chilli. This fiery side dish is a great accompaniment to a Chinese feast.
ingredients: 1-2 tbsp hot chilli bean paste, to taste
200ml fresh firm tofu, cut into 1.5cm squares
1 tbsp cornflour mixed with 2 tbsp water

method.Step 1: Heat a wok over a high heat and add half the oil. Add the aubergine and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until browned and softened. Add a few splashes of water to create some steam to help the aubergine cook, and cook for 1-2 minutes. Spoon the aubergine onto a plate.

method.Step 2: Add the remaining groundnut oil to the wok. When the oil starts to smoke, add the garlic, ginger and the red chilli and stir-fry for a few seconds. Add the hot chilli bean paste and stir together.

method.Step 3: Add the stock and the fresh tofu squares and bring to a simmer. Add the light soy sauce, vinegar and the brown sugar. Stir in the spring onions and the cornflour paste and cook to thicken for a minute. Serve with steamed jasmine rice, if you like.
